placeMetadata.address: No: 18, Othavadai Cross St, Fisherman Colony, Mahabalipuram, Tamil Nadu 603104, India

reviews.reviewText: My family is very happy to enjoy the spot. Beach access is very near. Good ambience with great taste of food. A good and pleasant staying resort for family.

I booked a super deluxe room which costs 5.2k/night. When I reached the place and see there super deluxe room I was shocked. It was smelling bad like people are not coming to the resort. The cupboard doors were broken. When I asked reception they said this is the only room. The whole resort was empty only 4 rooms were booked that day. I checked it in the morning during breakfast.
Even though the resort touched the beach but management is not capable to maintain the entity. As the resort touched beach so I gave 3 stars for the location.

Words cannot describe what I experienced, it is so good.. This is the best of all the resorts in the area.. Assistant general Manager SHADAB SHAIKH  Sir, we thank you very much for all the arrangements you made. I saw a good attitude from you, with love and respect, with good care. Thank you sir.

The place is good but made worse by pathetic service of staff. You would never get anything unless you ask 50 times. Room service wd be so late  that you would forget whatever u had ordered. Nobody picks up any nos. Basic like even  water and toiletries are not replaced . The staff looks at any opportunity to extract tips
Double check billing else be sure to be cheated

⭐ 1 Star for Service

Had a disappointing experience due to an incident. My brother-in-law, a wheelchair user, was in his hand-controlled car, parked near the restaurant. 🚗♿ The entrance was 400m away, making it impossible for him to reach by wheelchair.

😠 Security kept pestering us to move the car, forcing us to leave early. This was extremely inconvenient and disappointing.

👍 Food was good 🍽️, and the location was stunning 🌅, but the cost was on the higher side 💰.

🚨 Not recommended for wheelchair users due to accessibility issues and poor handling by staff.

Experience was very bad and totally not a good resort to have a vacation !!
L

Room service and house keeping is not good and worst treatment !!
And we followed up them for 4 to 5 times for Room service and House keeping too but still again we need to follow up them for the 6th time !

Room sea view was good and it was only worth it in this resort but we payed around 15K and it wasn’t worth at all !

And Again coming food it was totally below average and not good in taste even starters as well as main course !!

The spot was good and beach was good rest all not worthy for 5000 room had a bad smell because of bathroom with old wooden cupboard free breakfast was just okay no more options swimming pool was High clorine we felt eye burn for 1 day restaurant was very costly only rich very rich can afford not the middle class,just for beech you can better choose something else I would recommend only for 3000 max else don't go

Very nice trip recently
Great sea view room n superb staff everyone was so good
Only thing is restaurant food items were very expensive... 2x price of other good restaurants

placeMetadata.name: Blue Moon guesthouse

sources.snippet: The beaches and the seventh-century temples are within close vicinity of the guest house. This two-bedroom house has a private terrace and a balcony, both offering stunning views of the sea. The beach and ancient temples are also only a stroll away.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Beach Houses In Mahabalipuram, India - Updated 2025

placeMetadata.address: J5CW+HX2, Tsunami Nagar 3rd Cross St, Fisherman Colony, Mahabalipuram, Tamil Nadu 603104, India

reviews.reviewText:
Basic, clean and friendly guesthouse at an unbeatable price. Nice walk into town in the backstreets away from traffic and noise. Two minutes down to the beach.
Breakfast was basic continental👍🏽
And the common space terrace on 3rd floor is spectacular any time of day, great views of the ocean and a nice place to relax and catch ones’ breath.
Recommend booking rooms on the 2nd floor, if available.
A great find! 🌺
A really good place to stay. Comfortable, clean, and reasonably priced. Breakfast on the terrace with a great view. 5-10 minute walk to the beach.

Excellent Rooms and friendly Service people are really very cool and needful. The location is ultimate and the neighbours are friendly with Hotel. It's a very good and Clean property if stay you will be enjoy lot. Thank you...
Great location, great view, decent rooms and good service at an affordable price.
Very kind host. Rooms are rather big and optional breakfast

Best guest house in Mahabalipuram according to me, the owner is a very humble and sweet guy. The room we stayed in was amazing. If the 2nd floor room is available ask for that room. But I would select any of the rooms since we don't spend the whole day in the room. Easily accessible to the restaurants around and safe.
Great location - only five minute from the beach - clean rooms - quiet - no meal or drink beside the breakfast
Suitable for couples and well maintained with friendly staffs . Sugan brother was so nice in our needs ,highly recommended ✅

placeMetadata.name: Coco Retreat Mahabalipuram

sources.snippet: Are you on the lookout for the best beach resorts in Mahabalipuram, which offer spacious rooms as well as other high-end amenities?. Then, Coco Retreat Mahabalipuram, with its highly-embellished suites and private lounges, should be the just the right choice for you. Besides the normal amenities, such as free parking and shared lounge system, the resort also offers free breakfast and dinner through its in-house eatery.
sources.shortName: 20 Beach Resorts In Mahabalipuram, Book & Get Upto 50% Off

placeMetadata.address: No:5,art farm house , Kalpakkam main road Mahabalipuram town, opp. to golden chariot, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 603102, India

reviews.reviewText:
We had attended a kids birthday party here. The party took place outside of the hotel on the lawn, which was beautifully decorated and set up by the hotel staff.
They had a live dosa and pasta counter set up alongside the buffet, which I liked. They served both veg and non veg, and I must say that I enjoyed all the dishes that I tasted. The food was fresh and of good quality, so that made it more appealing.
Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel for their ambience, food and service, especially its location as it is only few meters away from the sea shell museum.

It was a great evening having attended a birthday party in this place.. the ambience was awesome and serene. The food was very homely and can be offered to kids as well. The staffs were very attentive and patience enough to handle our kids during the party. This place is very much close to sea shell muaseam and pancharatha tourist spot of Mahabalipuram... We can plan a weekend for a calm stay here along with beautiful sight seeing of Mahabalipuram.

Cool place. Total privacy for family members. Can accomodate 5 to 6 families. Approx. 20 members. Swimming area to relax. Play area for shuttle, football and badmiton. If Coffee n tea is  provided inside the resort will be added advantage. It's far to get to go out for this.

Coco Retreat is a private well maintained villa with clean hospitality, The food served was also yummy and affordable. Rooms & Hall were really spacious for enjoy with family and friends. The Swimming Pool & Play area with lawn for kids and adults was enjoyable. A perfect gateway from city life.

Number 1 cheating resort. Color of pool looked green and totally disappointed for us. They are adding fake reviews to keep it as 4.1 rating. Dont belive the photos as swimming pool photos are taken long back. The pic i shown here is the original pool color. U can go here if swimming pool doesnt matter. Even rooms had fans at low speed. Acs not great in certain rooms etc.
We blocked the entire place for our outing. Place is good and service and taste of food is also awesome.  We are going to this facility for 5th time which is classic example of their services

Awesome place and awesome stay!! The staff were too darn kind. The whole vibe was good and loved the swimming pool too! Just a constructive criticism, please clean the bathrooms before the guests step in..
Great place. Very much spacious for 40people stay. Care taker were very  much helpfull.we had a family get-together every one enjoyed . swimming pool was the best part .

placeMetadata.name: Coast Away, Palatial Heritage Villa Mahabalipuram

sources.shortName: 12 Best Beach Houses In Mahabalipuram, India - Updated 2025

placeMetadata.address: 57, Kings Nagar, SH 49, Mahabalipuram, Tamil Nadu 603104, India

reviews.reviewText: Great place to chill as a group. Great location, food and stay. Away from the crowds and close to the beach. Only downside was the non-availability of Wi-Fi.

Good place to chill out for night or two. Proximity to beach is plus point. We can relax at the gym with a view to the ocean. Its amazing. Bathrooms can be maintained a little better. Care taker was very friendly and humble.

We had an absolutely fantastic stay.
The accommodation  was everything we could have hoped for - clean, comfortable, and equipped with all the amenities to make our stay both relaxing and convenient. Very friendly owner.
The food also was too good.
Being able to walk down to the beach in just 2 minutes was a dream come true.
Enjoyed the breathtaking sunrise in the morning.

We're already planning our next trip back!
Amazing traditional style home with some contemporary mixed in. Quiet spacious. The caretakers were very efficient.

No matter what I write it is not going to be enough. We absolutely loved this home stay and I don’t think we can ever visit Mahabs and not stay here. Just a min walk away from the beach with the most friendly caretaker/cook and what a serene environment!
Our family (with the youngest being 5 and oldest being 75) thoroughly loved Coast away. Good place for large groups with plenty of bed and common space.
Must stay!!!

We, a group of friends stayed at Coast Away for three days. This is an excellent property- a large Chettiinaf style villa, just about 200 meters off the highway and located close to the beach. There are four large rooms - two each on the ground and upper floor, a large open courtyard and patio - all very well and tastefully furnished. Bed linens were clean.
All bedrooms have large attached bathrooms. Basic amenities and towels are provided in these.
Dining table can accommodate 8 persons comfortably
There is a nice library in the upper floor. The Terrance offers a view of the Bay of Bengal.
Covered parking is adequate for two mid sized SUVs- extra cars can be parked in the open.
There is DG back up - so no need to worry about the power fluctuation
Ms Ilaivarassy, the caretaker is attentive, efficient, courteous and a great cook !
Overall a good and cost effective place to stay !

PS - one suggestion for improvement is to get the access road surface done up. There are many ditches and sharp rock edges on this narrow stretch which makes driving in a tedious experience. The owner was very accommodating on couple of other small feedback given during our stay- hope this major requirement also gets her attention!

Nice place to spend time with family. The house is beautiful and thoughtfully constructed. The rooms and common area sit outs are spacious which makes it great place for gatherings and having a buffet as well. Although the rooms have netted doors, only concern were the mosquitos at night.
The property is just at a stone throw distance from the beach. But the beach appears dirty most probably could be due to industrial waste or oil spills. Overall it was a great stay and we wished to have stayed longer. Would definitely want to visit again. 🙂

We visited Chennai from Saskatoon, Canada for a visit with family and rented Coast Away for a week-long get-together with our siblings and their families. We had a fantastic time. It was just perfect for our family and the food served by Illavarasi was an added bonus. Tasty, home food and she could cook whatever we asked for.

The house was spacious and a lot of room to just sit around and chat or play board games and relax. The host has set up this house with at most care to make it absolutely delightful stay for anyone. Though the beach is very close we did not use the beach too often since we had more than enough to keep us occupied and relaxed in the house...also the beach was quite filthy.

Radha was a great and kind host. Always responded to our queries immediately went out of the way to make our stay comfortable. Thank you!

placeMetadata.name: Welcomhotel Kences Palm Beach Mahabalipuram

sources.snippet: What can be more relaxing and refreshing than staying at a private beach resort during your vacation?. Just the mere sound of waves crashing and the stillness of the sea during the nights will make you feel at peace and sleep better. Staying close to the beach can calm your mind and soul.
sources.shortName: Resorts in Mahabalipuram Book 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 ₹𝟬 𝗣𝗔𝗬𝗠𝗘𝗡𝗧

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled across nine acres of stunning landscape, Welcomhotel Kences Palm Beach Mahabalipuram offers an idyllic escape with mesmerizing views of the Bay of Bengal. With over 90 diverse accommodation options, including charming rooms, luxurious suites, and inviting cottages and bungalows, guests can find their perfect retreat. The spacious verandahs of the cottages and private balconies in the elegantly designed bungalows enhance your stay.
placeMetadata.address: Mahabalipuram, Tamil Nadu 603104, India

placeMetadata.name: IVY VILLA - Beach House for Rent in ECR

sources.snippet: It has an open shower, a private swimming pool, a fish pond, and private beach access. The garden and the sound of the waves add tranquility to the place. Internet access and air-conditioning in the rooms are provided.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Beach Houses In Mahabalipuram, India - Updated 2025

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Ivy Villa is the ultimate beachside retreat for those seeking a private and tranquil getaway. Inspired by Balinese design, this spacious villa boasts a stunning private swimming pool, a serene fish pond, and lush gardens filled with vibrant banana plants. With direct access to the beach, guests can enjoy the soothing sounds of waves lapping at the shore throughout their stay. This luxurious escape features modern amenities and an open-concept layout that seamlessly blends comfort with style.
placeMetadata.address: No.163, Mamallapuram Rd, VENPURUSHAM VILLAGE, Mahabalipuram, Tamil Nadu 603104, India

reviews.reviewText: Ivy Villa offers an exceptional stay with an atmosphere that feels luxurious. From the moment I arrived, it was clear that a lot of thought had been put into every aspect of the villa. The attention to detail is impressive- whether it’s the decor, the quality of the furnishings, or the thoughtful touches . Every corner felt carefully curated, creating a relaxing and aesthetically pleasing environment. The landscaping and gardening were also beautifully done, adding to the serene and picturesque setting. The staff was attentive without being intrusive, and the overall ambiance made it easy to unwind and enjoy the surroundings. If you’re looking for a place that combines comfort with style, Ivy Villa is a fantastic choice.

Was peaceful & relaxing gateway considering the city commotions. Great place to plan a staycation. The beach behind the resort was very private & and had a lovely picnic too!

Having Balinese concept in chennai was very nice, we asked the care taker to buy the ingredients & we cooked our meal which was a good family reunion & played some board games that was available at the resort.

Do try!

Loved every bit of my stay at this Balinese architecture inspired place with the most  beautiful garden and a temp controlled pool.. what struck me the most was the attention to detail in every aesthetic and also the fairly equipped kitchen being the most convenient to use for almost anyone.. felt home away from home..
Cant wait to go back!
#ItsmahaBALIpuram

Ivy Villa offers a peaceful and cozy stay with well-maintained rooms and a homely ambiance. The staff is courteous and attentive, ensuring a comfortable experience throughout. Ideal for a relaxing getaway amidst nature.

A wonderful property to enjoy Bali vibes with your loved ones… Not far from the city, yet away from the hustle bustle of city life. Very calm place with classy decor. They have access to the beach too. The Candle light dinner and early morning breakfast in the pool were amazing and added that cherry on the cake. We really had lot of fun and gonna come back very soon 😊
Such a wonderful stay . The housekeeping person was very kind . Loved the outdoor. Worth the pay

It costed around 21k per night, and I had specifically requested for candle light as it was my husband's birthday. Candle light setup was part of the package for me. But it was a complete disaster. There were  5 plastic candle bulbs setup. Thatsall. Movie was also not screened. In spite of repeated requests, it was confirmed it would be done nicely, and it was a dismay
2. Poor wifi. There is Airtel dongle. But it did not work.
3. As it was raining, several frogs, and insects were swimming along with us  in the pool.
4. Aesthetic batharea. But same issue as above.

On the whole, great ambience, a good getaway with friends.. but not so great service and amenities. When we are in a lone getaway, we completely rely on service.

I booked Ivy villa to chill with friends during the weekend.Right from the booking , the service everything was beyond beautiful.🔝💗

The whole experience of stay with Ivy Villa was really good. Felt like we escaped the chaotic city vibes and had an amazing time with friends in a peaceful ambience. Will surely recommend this place for some real Bali vibes🌴🌺🍹

placeMetadata.name: Jayam Resort

sources.snippet: There are many couple-friendly resorts in Mahabalipuram like Blue Bay Beach Resort, Landmark Pallava Beach Resort, Jayam Resort, Alegria Resorts and Spa, and many others. Couples can reconnect and rekindle their relationships by utilising the modernised and luxurious amenities these resorts provide.
sources.shortName: Resorts in Mahabalipuram Book 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 ₹𝟬 𝗣𝗔𝗬𝗠𝗘𝗡𝗧

placeMetadata.description: Unassuming hotel featuring an alcohol-free restaurant, an outdoor pool & a game room.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled in the charming coastal town of Mahabalipuram, Jayam Resort offers a serene escape for travelers seeking relaxation and connection. This unpretentious hotel features an alcohol-free restaurant, making it a perfect choice for families and couples alike. Guests can enjoy the outdoor pool and game room, providing ample opportunities for leisure and fun. With 20 air-conditioned rooms equipped with kitchens, visitors can feel right at home during their stay.
placeMetadata.address: No.1/1, Kattunaicken Street, Opposite Light House, Mahabalipuram, Tamil Nadu 603104, India

reviews.reviewText: Decent and clean place to stay in mahabas, but swimming pool is contaminated and left to dead so avoid jumping in it other tha that over all it's a good place to stay and chill

This resort not meet expectations. The worst part is their poor service. Dinnings are closed. No food facilities we have to arrange from outside which is big minus for resort's. Rooms are neat pool ok overall 3.5/5

For the price I payed, the stuff was to unprofessionell, the rooms were to filthy and after you ask for the breakfast, some streat food is brought. When we arrived at the hotel, we had to wait for half an hour as they were cleaning the rooms. Also it's nice to have a swimming pool but it's a pitty you cannot use it because it's dirty. Make it cheaper or put a little more effort in customer service and cleaning please. The location is good though.

Very Horrible experience of stay we had:

*No Chefs for Restaurant.
*Complimentary Breakfast - no option in the menu.
*Swimming pool not at all in the condition to use.
*Geyser Line - not working in any rooms.
*Hot Water - only 2 Buckets for 4 persons.
*Room Service - no intercom / Bell to ring, every time had to walk to the reception.
*Room Cleaning - only after checkout .
TV - only 4-5 channels (will not be our preferred channels).
Night stay - with mosquitoes.

A good place for you and your friends. I would think twice to take my family here. There's always a group of friends here boozing and smoking. This place has got a good swimming pool which is not deeper than 5.5 feet approximately. The rooms are far good. There are two wooden dining towers which actually add beauty too this place. This resort will be in my priority for my next weekend getaway with my friends.

The only saving grace of this place is the location and adequate parking (which in Mahabalipuram can be a real pain). The property was obviously developed with high expectations, but now has a run down feel with negligent standards of service. You have to ask for even simple things like towels and soap. One room had only one pillow on a double bed, without pillow covers. The pool needs tending and has bugs that have made it a home. Water wastage is criminal with leaking pipes and overflowing tanks. Our overhead tank overflowed all night creating a racket next to our room and no one was there to tend to it when we tried informing the staff (after 8pm there are no staff)! The property has potential, but the management needs to really brush up their tardy act. And the prices they charge are certainly not justifies for all these lapses. It supposedly is on Oyo, but no oyo standard is maintained here.

The resort is not quite stylish as expected. Pretty decent resort for a good weekend getaway for guy's.

For family outing think twice before booking, couple of college folks booze and smoke nearby.

The place has very good location, it's near light house, beach and sea shore temple and other tourism places as well.

I had a decent stay, didn't order any room nor did I order anything from restaurant, assuming the quality would not be upto standard.

Altogether rooms are very good for boy's at party.

Attaching some photos which I clicked during checkout (rooms were decent when I entered). Balcony for smoking. Light house view outside my room.

No cleanliness. Room they gave us smells badly that v can't even bare to stay for few mins. It seems Not cleaned anything after previous check out, left over stains, cigarette bits. From bathroom got a hell like smell n not cleaned that too. Next day evening they gave us another room. That too not cleaned after previous check out. Stains in bed cover, floor too not cleaned. ESPECIALLY WE NEED TO WAIT HELL A LOT OF TIME FOR HOT WATER. They ll prepare it from stove n ll give us after v asking it for tons of times. V GONE FOR A SHOOT, MISSED MAJOR PART BECAUSE OF THEIR LAZINESS

Absolutely not maintained. Poor service. Had to ask for everything several times and yet requests went unanswered. Woke me up every morning early for random things, like asking to pay the previous day's food bill of Rs. 200 while I am still on bed. Second day went a step ahead asking me to pay the entire room tariff once again cause they haven't received the payment from goibibo. Were asking me to pay in cash and settle it with Goibibo seperately. Had to ask for the Managing Director to get it sorted. Nobody in the premises speaks English. Absolutely pathetic. Never to return.

placeMetadata.name: Pearl Beach

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled in the serene Paramankeni Village, 154 Pearl Beach is a delightful getaway located just 400 meters from its own stretch of sandy shore. This charming accommodation offers guests easy access to the beautiful coastline while being only 2.8 kilometers away from the popular TTDC Boat House. With a vibrant atmosphere that includes karaoke nights, it’s an inviting spot for travelers looking to unwind and enjoy some fun by the sea.

reviews.reviewText: Open to everyone. There are no private beaches in India as per law.

One of India's oldest structural temples, this Hindu place of worship looks over the Bay of Bengal.
Modern resort with an outdoor pool, a spa & a buffet restaurant, plus a bar offering beach views.

Laid-back resort offering 2 outdoor pools, a gym & a private beach area, plus free Wi-Fi.

ops.insert: Understated quarters in a refined beachfront hotel with a restaurant, a spa & a poolside grill.
World Heritage-listed, shoreline, stone temple complex dating from the 7th–8th centuries.
Offbeat tourist attraction featuring a massive granite boulder perched on a downhill slope.

Collection of approximately 40,000 seashells & marine fossils from around the world.
Upscale resort with an outdoor pool, a spa, & a private beach, plus a 24-hour bar & 2 restaurants.
